result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Allen Michalski Jr

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report, filed.

Defendant Richard Allen Michalski Jr in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Richard Allen Michalski Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  For reasons placed on the record, Court joins 22CM541, 22CM1392, 22CM1782, 22CM2433 for trial.  Due to Court's scheduling, Court will vacate previously scheduled jury trial date and will reset trial date.  Case adjourned, Br. 13.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022

Defendant Richard Allen Michalski Jr in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Richard Allen Michalski Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Discussion held. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Jury instructions to be filed by 10/3/22.
Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - received and filed

Defendant Richard Allen Michalski in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard Allen Michalski appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pretrial conference with 22CM541. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests scheduling date. Case adjourned to Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Crime Victim RIghts Request Form, filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richard Allen Michalski in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Richard Allen Michalski in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard Allen Michalski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Diane C.B.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
